meanings.definition: A person who collects revenue, especially a government official.
meanings.sent1: The revenuer came to our town to gather taxes from the residents.
meanings.sent2: The revenuer counted the money collected from businesses to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The children in the neighborhood joked that the revenuer was like a money detective.
meanings.sent4: The revenuer was like a financial guardian, watching over the funds of the state.
meanings.sent5: The image of the revenuer meticulously counting coins stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for generating income or profits.
meanings.sent1: As a skilled revenuer, she knew how to increase sales for the company.
meanings.sent2: The successful entrepreneur was a master revenuer, always finding new ways to make money.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a lemonade stand was her way of training to be a young revenuer.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, she was known as the revenuer who could turn any venture profitable.
meanings.sent5: Her reputation as a top revenuer spread throughout the industry.
